result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan Winfield Moungey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Logan Winfield Moungey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Logan Winfield Moungey was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With work release/huber.  May be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept, including Vernon County.  Def to submit DNA sample; check in with Richland County Sheriff's Department regarding this matter and the matter of the jail transfer request.

Jail stayed until on or before June 1, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Logan Winfield Moungey in court with attorney James D Thibodeau. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CM24/plea and sentencing, as well as status in 15TR84, 85 and 86.  Atty. T informs the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution of these matters, calling for def's plea to OWI 2nd in 15CM24 for dismissal of 15TR84, 15TR85, and 15TR86, as well as Count 2 in 15CM24.  Def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  $650 base for total of $1757, 40 days jail, 18 mo revocation, AODA/driver safety plan, IID upon relicensing for 18 months.  Huber.  Jail may be served in any Wisconsin jail that will accept including Vernon County.  Submit DNA sample - check at RCSD before leaving today.  $66 blood draw costs for Richland County.

0 days credit.

Count 2 dismissed.  TR cases dismissed.

Jail start stayed until on or before Monday, June 1, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.

Defendant Logan Winfield Moungey appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advise the Court that the parties are ready to resolve this case.  However, Atty. M states that the def will be asking for a stay of the jail; states def does not qualify for electronic monitoring in Richland County as he does not work in Richland County; needs to do jail in Vernon County.  Court will adjourn this matter; not apt to proceed to sentencing if def not prepared to begin the sentence immediately.  Court adj. to May 27 at 11 for potential plea/sentencing in 15CM24 and status in the TR cases.  Court instructs defense to have the arrangements set prior to the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney James D Thibodeau appeared by phone means for Defendant Logan Winfield Moungey. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Called together with 15TR84, 15TR85 & 15TR86. Court give atty Thibodeau permission to appear by phone for the AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 11:00 am.
